1122844233944182785.text:
"Mistake #5:  You try to solve the problem yourself, because you’re the domain expert." - @clairejlew

It's so hard to break this habit, but you're hiring a team for a reason.  Let them make mistakes and solve problems from their perspective.
#hiringhttps://m.signalvnoise.com/the-9-mistakes-you-dont-know-youre-making-as-a-new-manager/ …

1122672604626788357.text:
A reminder by @clairejlew of something obvious and important but at the same time so very difficult when you're in the thick of it: “Work on the business, not in the business.”
https://buff.ly/2UTClqc pic.twitter.com/ULLqUBDpap

1118494816331894785.text: Some really good advice in this article by @clairejlew. For example, what builds trust with a team? “Being vulnerable as a leader, sharing your intention, and following through on your commitment.”https://m.signalvnoise.com/the-9-mistakes-you-dont-know-youre-making-as-a-new-manager/ …

1121059975718211584.text: "42% of employees wanted managers to communicate more regularly and 38% said they wish their managers shared more of their decisions and the reasons behind them. While you might feel you’re communicating enough, your team feels otherwise." - @clairejlewhttps://m.signalvnoise.com/the-9-mistakes-you-dont-know-youre-making-as-a-new-manager/ …

1121459901686001670.text:
"Especially early in my career, I really wanted somebody to save me. I really wanted a great mentor."

I loved @bryce's view that sometimes we have to sink in order to swim, ‍+ not rely too heavily on others. Check out the latest Heartbeat interview: https://knowyourteam.com/blog/podcast/episode-37-interview-with-bryce-roberts-founder-of-indie-vc-co-founder-of-oatv/ …pic.twitter.com/Zmp0JWAttQ

1121469426459729921.text:
I'm putting together research for a Guide to Managing Remote Teams... but would love YOUR input. Biggest challenges? Things you wish you knew?

Please fill out quick survey below I'll happily give you a free copy of the guide when I'm done writing it https://kyteam.typeform.com/to/qP7EUF

1120342251027222528.text:
At their core, leaders are masters of attention:

Are we paying attention to the market?
Are we paying attention to our customers?
Are we paying attention to the realities of our team?
Are we paying attention to ourselves?

1120700606036041728.text:
Leaders, are you asking yourself:

Am I creating environ. for ppl to do their best work?
Am I creating clarity + coherence re: what needs to get done + why?
Am I modeling behavior I want to be true across my team?
Am I seeing things for what they are, not what I want them to be?

1120535216735567872.text: Finished this commissioned piece for a client, yesterday (who found me via Twitter, no less!) What a thrilling feeling to share art. Will be sending off to Seattle once fully dry. 20” x 24” oil on canvas, “Quiet”.pic.twitter.com/MypEwoM9jk

1093260083352371200.text:
Very excited to announce that The Heartbeat  –  our interview series on leadership – is now a podcast!

Brand new episode comes out tomorrow. Subscribe below so you don't miss it https://knowyourteam.com/blog/podcast/

1121782989543890944.text:
Instead of saying as a leader,“These are your goals…”  try asking:

“What goals would get you excited about achieving?”
“What should the team accomplish that you’d be proud of?”
“What kind of work would make you feel energized and ‘I’m glad I did that?’”

1118600537778245632.text:
Looking forward to the @sfelc_ panel tonight, alongside a wonderful crew: @ritubhargava SVP Engineering @salesforce, @pgarg VP Engineering @DocuSign, @edawerd co-founder @GustoHQ. 

If you’re around SF this evening, would love to have you join us: https://sfelc.com/event/what-to-start-and-stop-doing-when-moving-to-a-new-level-2019-04-17 …

1121422686104752130.text:
What advice have you been given, time and time again, yet have the hardest time internalizing, for some reason?

For me, it's: "Work on the business, not in the business."

Wrote a brand new piece about it below, heavily inspired by @natalienagele https://knowyourteam.com/blog/2019/04/24/work-on-the-business-and-not-in-the-business-as-leaders/ …

1123381673796755457.text:
Domain expertise and domain leadership are not the same thing. 

Expertise is, of course, formative for decision-making + credibility… but it doesn’t dictate your ability to understand team motivations, align them, chart a vision, and help everyone make progress toward it.

1119293640118079490.text:
We're obsessed w/ wanting to know "the answer" to becoming a better leader. Surprise: There isn't one. 

However, there are questions you can ask to reveal your *own* answer.  

Wrote brand new piece on the 4 essential q's to ask yourself as a leader:https://knowyourteam.com/blog/2019/04/19/a-different-kind-of-new-manager-checklist/ …

1122881035241447424.text:
"The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes." - Marcel Proust. 

How are you having "new eyes" as a leader? Are you... 

Seeking out many data sources? Involving others in thinking on smthg? Welcoming nuance vs. oversimplification?

1119076847449305088.text:
Been noticing how often we frame questions assuming there is one definitive answer.

Example: How do you recruit the best ppl?
Instead:  What have you tried when recruiting that's worked / not worked?

Our desperation for "the answer" robs us of a whole range of learning.

1121065514913214465.text:
Should you become a manager? A few things to consider:

- How much do you enjoy being in "flow"?
- Does repeating yourself drive you nuts?
- How big of control freak are you?
- Do you like to "play detective" about ppl?
- Is your default reaction to conflict "ack, I do not like"?
